education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science

responsibilities: Contributed to the development of an Unreal Engine plugin using C++ to interface with OpenAI's API, enabling behavior tree generation and model refinement through AI prompts.
Implemented blackboard integration to gather environmental data, transforming it into JSON format to be processed by the AI model for behavior tree optimization.

projects.name: Data Processing Pipelines
details: Created a repository for processing column-based data and training models using Sklearn, XGBoost, and LightGBM.
Utilized Kubeflow and Docker to automate hyperparameter tuning with Ray Tune, optimizing model selection.

projects.name: Simulation Agents
details: Implemented a collection of 9 core behaviors and multiple subtrees using Rust and XML for autonomous agents within Computer Generated Forces (CGFs) simulations.
Contributed to white papers detailing the architecture and documentation for intelligent agents.

projects.name: Data Analytics Layer
details: Implemented MinIO, Trino, and Iceberg on Kubernetes using Helm charts, laying the groundwork for a scalable data analytics layer to process simulation data from CGFs.
Set the stage for future expansion, including UI integration and enhanced data accessibility, as part of a collaborative effort within a 3-person team.

projects.name: SMS Spam Detection with Transformers
details: Employed a Natural Language Processing model called DistilBERT to analyze a dataset of spam and non-spam text.
Used Python libraries (sklearn, NumPy, pandas) to preprocess data and train the model.
Achieved a high level of accuracy, with a Receiver Operating Characteristic (ROC) Curve of 98% True Positive Rate.

projects.name: Identifying ASL with Machine Learning and AI
details: Developed a Convolutional Neural Network using Keras to accurately identify ASL images.
Performed research using various Python libraries including NumPy, seaborn, and sklearn to preprocess data.
Showcased findings at the 2022 Florida Undergraduate Regional Conference (FURC).

projects.name: Bloomberg Tech Lab on Campus
details: Collaborated with Bloomberg engineers in a small group to build an application using RabbitMQ and Docker.
Utilized Python to design and implement a robust message queue system using RabbitMQ, enhancing real-time data processing and communication between producer and consumer components.

projects.name: Campus Connect
details: Developed a web application using the PERN stack to connect students to local events around their university.
Employed a React Framework connecting to a PostgreSQL Database hosted on Heroku.
Implemented complex user permissions and data integrity checks to ensure secure access to resources.

projects.name: Fintracker
details: Led the front-end development of a web and mobile application using a MERN stack.
Utilized React with Bootstrap to create a secure and user-friendly interface.
Enabled users to manage and track their finances for budgeting purposes securely and easily.
